Fluorouracil - Fluorouracil (5-FU or f5U) (sold under the brand names Adrucil, Carac, Efudix, Efudex and Fluoroplex) is a drug that is a pyrimidine analog which is used in the treatment of cancer.

cat: Arabic words and phrases in Sharia
wiki.text:
:URF redirects here; for other meanings, see [[URF (disambiguation)]].

'Urf' (العرف) is an Arabic Islamic term referring to the custom, or 'knowledge',
of a given society. To be recognized in an Islamic society, Urf must be
compatible with the Sharia law.<ref name="H. Patrick Glenn 2007, pg. 201">H.
Patrick Glenn, Legal Traditions of the World. Oxford University Press, 2007, pg.
201.</ref> When applied, it can lead to the deprecation or inoperability of a
certain aspect of fiqh فقه (Islamic jurisprudence).<ref name="H. Patrick Glenn
2007, pg. 201"/>

`Urf is a source of rulings where there are not explicit primary texts of the
Qur'an and Sunnah specifying the ruling. `Urf can also specify something
generally established in the primary texts.

In some countries such as Egypt, marriage, the Urfi way, means to get married
without official papers issued by the state (Zawag Urfi:زواج عرفي). This type of
marriage is valid and recognized; see: common law marriage.
wiki.title: urf
